case_vignette: A 14-year-old boy is brought to the physician because of fever, malaise, and severe right knee joint pain and swelling for 3 days. He had also had episodes of abdominal pain and epistaxis during this period. Five days ago, he had swelling and pain in his left ankle joint which has since resolved. He reports having a sore throat 3 weeks ago while he was camping in the woods, for which he received symptomatic treatment. His immunizations are up-to-date. His temperature is 38.7°C (101.6°F), pulse is 119/min, and blood pressure is 90/60 mm Hg. Examination shows a swollen, tender right knee; range of motion is limited. There are painless 3- to 4-mm nodules over the elbow. Cardiopulmonary examination is normal. His hemoglobin concentration is 12.3 g/dL, leukocyte count is 11,800/mm3, and erythrocyte sedimentation rate is 58 mm/h. Arthrocentesis of the right knee joint yields clear, straw-colored fluid; no organisms are identified on Gram stain. Analysis of the synovial fluid shows a leukocyte count of 1,350/mm3 with 17% neutrophils.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Rheumatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been feeling feverish, generally unwell, and I'm suffering from severe pain and swelling in my right knee that's been there for 3 days.
Is this pain and swelling new or have you experienced it before?
I had similar swelling and pain in my left ankle joint five days ago, but it's gone now.
What is your age and sex?
I'm a 14-year-old boy.
Have you been diagnosed with any chronic illnesses or taking any medications regularly?
No, I don't have any chronic illnesses and I'm not on any regular medications.
Based on the provided information, I suspect you may have Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis. To confirm, have you had any joint pain or swelling in other parts of your body besides your knees and ankles?
Yes, I've had episodes of abdominal pain and nosebleeds during this period as well.
Given the additional symptoms of abdominal pain and nosebleeds, I would like to explore further. Have you had any recent infections, such as a cold or the flu?
I had a sore throat 3 weeks ago while camping in the woods and received treatment just for the symptoms.
Based on the information provided, I would like to consider the possibility of Reactive Arthritis. To confirm, have you noticed any pus or discharge from your joints or other body openings?
No, there hasn't been any pus or discharge from my joints or other body openings.

Given the lack of pus or discharge, I would like to reconsider the possibility of Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis. To confirm, have you noticed any rashes or redness on your skin, especially around your eyes or mouth?

**Final Diagnosis:** Juvenile Idiopathic Arthritis.
